abstract: House oversight committee headed by Republican Rep Jason Chaffetz of Utah is probing allegations that Transportation Security Administration retaliated against employees who reported lapses in airport screening security and gave bonuses to supervisors who ignored warnings of such lapses.
lead_paragraph: The inquiry began after employees who reported security problems were punished for reporting problems and managers that ignored the reports received bonuses.

headline.main: T.S.A. Lapses, Retaliation and Bonuses Are Investigated by House Panel
headline.print_headline: House Committee Looks at Possible T.S.A. Lapses and Mistreatment

snippet: The inquiry began after employees who reported security problems were punished for reporting problems and managers that ignored the reports received bonuses.

keywords.value: Homeland Security Office of Inspector General
keywords.name: organizations
